claim: The average attribute value of neutral superheroes has increased steadily every year since 2000.
extra_info: average = AVG(attribute_value); neutral superheroes refers to alignment_id = 3;
reasoning: The claim references yearly trends ('increased steadily every year since 2000'), but the database contains no year, date, or any temporal column in any table. There is no way to compute or verify per-year averages because no time dimension exists in the schema. This is an out-of-schema case.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand what tables and columns are available.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

tool_use_result.stdout:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE alignment
(
    id        INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    alignment TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE attribute
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    attribute_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE colour
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    colour TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE publisher
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    publisher_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE race
(
    id   INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    race TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE hero_attribute
(
    hero_id         INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_id    INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_value INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (attribute_id) references attribute(id),
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id)
);
CREATE TABLE superpower
(
    id         INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    power_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE hero_power
(
    hero_id  INTEGER default NULL,
    power_id INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id),
    foreign key (power_id) references superpower(id)
);

content.text:
Now I can see the schema. The claim talks about "average attribute value of neutral superheroes" increasing "every year since 2000." The key issue is whether there's any temporal/year data in this database. Let me check:

- The `superhero` table has no year/date column.
- The `hero_attribute` table has no year/date column.
- No table appears to have any temporal data at all.

The claim references a concept of yearly trends ("increased steadily every year since 2000"), but the database has no year or date information whatsoever. There is no way to compute a per-year average because no temporal dimension exists in the schema.

Let me quickly confirm there's no hidden date/year column:

Confirmed. There is no year, date, or any temporal column in the database. The claim asserts that the average attribute value has "increased steadily every year since 2000," but the database has no temporal dimension to track changes over years. This is an **out-of-schema** situation.
